about_the_game:
Mango Goes to Mewsic School is a cute rhythm game where you play as a cat, Mango, trying to get into music school.

Traverse a trap-laden environment to learn from the masters, who will teach you the basics of four different music genres: afrobeats, jazz, classical, and K-pop. Become the best possible applicant by training your ears and mastering your craft!



EXPLORE FOUR MEWSICAL LANDS

Discover four different mewsical lands, each with its own genre of mewsic. Dodge deadly traps and choose your own path to each mewsical battle!

TOUR A CUTE AND COZY WORLD

Immerse yourself in Mango’s world as you talk to cute and supporting characters. Relax to the soothing music and dialogue that match the cozy atmosphere!

MASTER FOUR DIFFERENT MEWSICAL GENRES

Roll the dice and complete timed rhythm challenges to master each mewsical genre. Adapt to increasing challenges with new curveballs thrown your way!



This game was made by students in the University of Southern California’s Interactive Media and Games program in collaboration with students from the Berklee College of Music. The game was developed by Cecil Kong, Kaya Cook, Alyssa Harrison, Christopher Ken San Tan, Andy Lin, Jack Schooley, and Karina Wang. For more information, check out our publisher page. To learn more about the USC Games program, please visit the USC Games website.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8750H CPU @ 2.20GHz
  • Memory: 1024 MB RAM
  • Graphics: DX10
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Sound Card: DX10
